value.title: Coming soon: Changes to the Power BI service – simpler navigation, improvements to lists on Home, and style updates
value.excerpt: We continue to iteratively improve experiences that help you find relevant content and return to your work in the Power BI service. Upon hearing your feedback, conducting usability tests, and running successful A/B experiments we’re sharing the following changes coming to all users in early June 2022.

value.title: Analyze in Excel Workbooks are now saved to OneDrive for Business
value.excerpt: When users click Analyze in Excel in the Power BI service, the generated Excel workbook is automatically saved to OneDrive for Business and the workbook can be directly opened in a web browser using Excel for the web.

value.title: Managing Power BI subscriptions just got easier
value.excerpt: Subscriptions have become a popular way to stay connected with your reports and dashboards via email. As more users have begun to use subscriptions, we’ve received feedback that managing all these subscriptions can be challenging. value.title: Detect upload of sensitive information to Power BI using Microsoft 365 data loss prevention policies
value.excerpt: Today we’re happy to announce that we’re extending Microsoft 365 DLP policies for Power BI to support detection of uploading sensitive information such as social security and credit card numbers, leveraging Microsoft’s built-in sensitive information types and/or custom information types defined by your

value.title: Update to required permissions when using composite models on a Power BI dataset
value.excerpt: The ability to create a composite model on top of a Power BI dataset or an Azure Analysis Services model is in preview since December 2020. value.title: Heads up: The Power BI app is coming to Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Office (Preview)
value.excerpt: We’re excited to announce the Power BI app is coming to Outlook and Office. In this blog we’ll share the experiences, how to try it yourself, and what you can expect.

value.title: See what’s new for Power BI at the Microsoft Business Applications Launch Event
value.excerpt: Organizations face new challenges every day. Priorities change, markets shift, opportunities emerge—the pace isn’t slowing down. You don’t want to miss the digital launch event packed full of ways to help you adapt fast, collaborate with ease, innovate together, and make a positive impact.

value.title: Announcing general availability of service principal profiles in Power BI Embedded
value.excerpt: I’m happy to announce a new method that allows a much larger number of customer tenants per one service principal by introducing a service principal “child” named service principal profile.
